James Thangarajan once wore a Rastafarian wig for a week because he lost a bet PERIOD

Friends said Thangarajan a senior in the College of Technology had a sharp wit and would do anything to make someone laugh PERIOD

 said Thangarajans friend Michelle Ashcraft a Purdue alumna PERIOD

Thangarajans bright light was suddenly dimmed early Monday morning when he died in his sleep at Shreve Residence Hall PERIOD Thangarajan was  years old PERIOD The details behind Thangarajans death are still not known PERIOD Thangarajan was originally from Sri Lanka but his immediate family lives in Dubai PERIOD He was a private individual and always put others before himself Ashcraft said PERIOD

Thangarajan and Ashcraft worked together as Student Orientation Committee members for Boiler Gold Rush PERIOD Jenny Wierda the senior assistant director of student access transition and success programs said Thangarajans nickname among Boiler Gold Rush volunteers was Jimmy Bear PERIOD Thangarajan a former SOC member created a bear costume from scratch for a BGR training PERIOD

 she said PERIOD

Leslie Massaro another former SOC member said Thangarajan always let his friends know he cared PERIOD

 Massaro said PERIOD

His priority in life was making other people happy said his friend Neil Hudelson a junior in the College of Liberal Arts PERIOD 

Hudelson said one thing Thangarajan enjoyed was randomly calling friends and singing to them over the phone PERIOD



Hudelson recalled Thangarajan breaking into song at  a.m PERIOD outside a closed Jimmy Johns trying to get the deli to open PERIOD  he said PERIOD 

 Hudelson said PERIOD

Wierda said Thangarajans ability to laugh came from his passion for life PERIOD



Funeral arrangements are tentatively scheduled for Thursday but the details are not yet finalized PERIOD Updates will be posted on the Facebook group Forever in Our Hearts Rest in Peace James PERIOD
